node.title: DAY 7
node.excerpt:
Overtaking, Bridges, Flyby and headshots  After an excellent night in the superb accommodation where we received from the owners a huge donation to our cause. Nevertheless we all awoke tired and aching, nothing at all to do with the digs we’re all suffering from six days in the Cub’s saddle. Off we headed Anglesey way …

node.title: DAY 6
node.excerpt:
Moist, Lifeboats and waggon spray My apologies to regular readers yesterdays mileage was 163, quiz excitement got the better of me. Last night we arranged departure at 0800 sharp, however at awakening an hour prior the weather was moist dank and shitty, thus our leader texted all that a later departure  would suit the forecast. His …

node.title: DAY 5
node.excerpt:
Ice creams and Grand Theft Auto  By mutual decision breakfast in the lodgings was foregone, departure at 0800. As our accommodation was in the midst of a business area bisected by arterial roads it was decided to use our back up navigation system Deafmannav. This to the uninformed is the audio trail from Google maps …

node.title: DAY 2
node.excerpt:
Time, Accidents and U Turns  This morning our Time Lord threw us a curved ball by being a full ten minutes early for the allocated breakfast slot. As we ate breakfast at exactly 0840 Bowie requested a departure time, our initial suggested time of 0837 was rejected as was 0859. We finally settled on 0901, …

Suspense, spares and packing. Tomorrow at 0700 the three disturbed cavaliers embark on leg three, the final stage of the circumnavigation of the UK on the 50 Cubs. node.excerpt:
The journey home After the late finish on the final day the team dined in the accommodation and had a few refreshments before retiring thoroughly exhausted. Envy, The Isle of Wet, Grandparents, Westward bound and journeys end. The previous evening saw the trio after a few well earned beers encamped in an Indian restaurant.
